verses.roman:
petuḥ śirāṁsi rathinām
aśvināṁ gajināṁ bhuvi
sa-kuṇḍala-kirīṭāni
soṣṇīṣāṇi ca koṭiśaḥ

synonyms: petuḥ—fell; śirāṁsi—the heads; rathinām—of those riding on chariots; aśvinām—of those riding horses; gajinām—of those riding elephants; bhuvi—to the ground; sa—with; kuṇḍala—earrings; kirīṭāni—and helmets; sa—with; uṣṇīṣāṇi—turbans; ca—and; koṭiśaḥ—by the millions.
translation: The heads of soldiers fighting on chariots, horses and elephants fell to the ground by the millions; some heads wore earrings and helmets, others turbans.
